<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 265, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 3 Theory (Core)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[707, 300, 905, 316]]<|/det|>
October/November 2021  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 325, 905, 340]]<|/det|>
1 hour 15 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 395, 370]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 383, 359, 399]]<|/det|>
No additional materials are needed.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 230, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 808, 574]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You may use a calculator.- You should show all your working and use appropriate units.- Take the weight of \(1.0 \text{kg}\) to be \(10 \text{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 10 \text{m/s}^2\)).  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 603, 220, 618]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 619, 730, 651]]<|/det|>

<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 841, 91]]<|/det|>
A group of students are taking measurements so they can calculate the speed of sound.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 103, 475, 121]]<|/det|>
The students and their teacher are outside.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 134, 737, 152]]<|/det|>
The teacher holds two blocks of wood and the students have stop-watches.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 165, 737, 183]]<|/det|>
The teacher stands a long distance from the students, as shown in Fig. 7.1.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 196, 479, 214]]<|/det|>
All the students can see the teacher clearly.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[139, 222, 828, 339]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[408, 354, 591, 371]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 7.1</label> <label>(not to scale)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 384, 920, 418]]<|/det|>
The teacher claps the two blocks of wood together to produce a loud sound. The students measure the time interval between seeing the teacher clap and hearing the sound.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 432, 146, 450]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 432, 920, 465]]<|/det|>
Fig. 7.2 shows three of the stop-watches. The stop-watches show three of the values recorded for the time interval.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 472, 841, 597]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[465, 606, 534, 625]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 7.2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 636, 883, 655]]<|/det|>
Calculate the average value for the time intervals shown on the stop-watches in Fig. 7.2.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[391, 714, 920, 732]]<|/det|>
<form>average time interval = ............................................... s [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 72, 185, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 72, 920, 104]]<|/det|>
State the name of the instrument needed to measure the distance between the teacher and the students.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[850, 117, 920, 135]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 148, 181, 166]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>
